title: Couple stopped at airport security after cat sneaked into their luggage
text:
The cat was checked by security (Picture: Caters)

We know cats love to curl up in a cardboard box, but it turns out they are also partial to a suitcase.

A couple were shocked when they were pulled aside at the airport to examine an unexpected item inside this morning.

Nick and Voirrey Coole were travelling from the Isle of Man to New York to celebrate Nick’s 40th birthday when the cat decided it wanted to come too.

One of their hand luggages was left empty so they could come back with gifts.

They had no idea why their bag had been pulled to the side for additional checking, wondering what they might have left in there.

When they were pulled into the interrogation room the couple became worried and knew it was serious – until they were told one of their three cats, Candy, had sneaked into their suitcase.

The cat being checked at the airport (Picture: Caters)

Nick and Voirrey Coole (Picture: Caters)

Thankfully, the couple were not prosecuted for the unexpected passenger and still made their flight on time due to Voirrey’s father, Barry, rushing to the airport to pick up the kitty.

Nick, 40, said: ‘We have three cats and one of them, Candy, loves to get into bags or boxes.

‘Our hand luggage didn’t have much in it because we wanted to bring shopping home, but Candy had other ideas.

‘She must have snuck into the bag before we left for the airport, but we didn’t hear or feel her at all on the journey there.

‘When we got to security we didn’t need to check inside the bag, as nothing was in there, so put it on the conveyor belt.

Candy didn’t want to be left behind (Picture: Caters)

‘Airport security were all very puzzled and repeatedly asked us if the bag was ours after it had been through the scanner.

‘We ran out of ideas for what it could have been, and my wife even asked them “It’s not a cat is it?”

‘When we were told it was we were totally shocked and worried to what happens next, because I’ve never seen the rules on this one.

‘Luckily the staff were amazing and helped us organise to get Candy home so we still managed to make our flight.

‘My wife’s father, Barry, came to pick her up and she’s now back at home being looked after while we enjoy our trip.’
